macro.para:
This macro introduces a context value which can be retrieved via , , or . If bit expands to 0, then a directly nested invocation of inside the x or __VA_ARGS__ will expand to 0. Otherwise, it will expand to 1.
#define MACRO() ()
(0)((MACRO)()) // 0 (1)((MACRO)()) // 1

This macro employs , and allows the establishment of up to nested contexts. The most current context can be accessed with , contexts relative to the current context can be accessed with , and absolute contexts can be accessed with .

macro.abstract: The macro retrieves the context value of a context at an absolute position.

usage.param: The index of the context frame whose context value is to be retrieved. Valid values range from 1 to .

macro.para: This macro expands to the context value at position n. If no context is present at position n, this macro expands to nothing.

macro.abstract: The macro retrieves the context value of a context relative to the current context.

usage.param: The offset from the current context to the context frame whose context value is to be retrieved. Valid values range 0 to - 1.

macro.para: This macro expands to the context value of the context n outer frames from the current context frame. In other words, (0) expands to the current context value, (1) expands to the next outer context, (2) expands to the next outer context after that, and so on. If no context exists n frames outward, this macro expands to 0.

macro.abstract: The macro retrieves the context value of the most current context.
macro.para: If the most current context value is 1, this macro expands to 1. Otherwise, it expands to 0.
